channel.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
channel.description:
Hey there 2 questions.
I have 3 worlds set up and I am just wondering if there is a way to do these 2 things:
The First one being that if a player is online on one world and tries to login to another world with the account already logged in the server would deny it because it's on the other world (Like Real RS World system)
The second one is that the Worlds are for Staff/Donators only. I have a PVP server and I want to have a world for Staff/Donators only.
Is there a way of doing any of these 2? (I don't want to create 2 seperate folders for 2 servers because I want the character files to be synced with both servers.

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @strucker Strucker
item.description:
@strucker wrote:

lol i just ran the servers on different ports and made the player register on login where all the server have acces, in the login protocol i check if the player is logged if it is send the return code 5

Read full topic
item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Gh0stPred, post:15, topic:542719”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=661594.msg4422935#msg4422935 date=1399320448]

The only thing that would need to change to make it either donor only or staff only is have the server check on log in to see if the person is in fact a donor or staff member.

More or less all you would need to add to your log in block is.

if (rank) {
continue on;
else
send message;
}

^
In RSLoginProtocolDecoder (in a standard pi) you could check the donator rights and if they’re not a donator have it return a return code (lol yeah) and then add that return code id client sided, which would show the appropriate message of “You must be a Donator to login” or similar.
If you’re wondering what I’m talking about, search “Error connecting to server” client sided, probably in Client.java.

Right. Thing is though I don’t have the file you were saying. I only have RS2LoginProcotol. I don’t have the Decoder one. I have added the Donator Code in there now I just need to get that code to work with the second world.

I have also added the message already regarding staff/donator.

Well… You can technically name the classes whatever… Because I don’t have RS2LoginProtocol but I have RS2LoginProtocolDecoder. So your file might be the same as mine, just a different name.
[/quote]

Ahh ok. I’ll see if that works

EDIT:

Right. I managed to get it working BUT. Heres the new problem now. If I put the code like this

[spoiler]if (cl.donatorLevel == 0) {
returnCode = 12;
}[/spoiler]

No one can login even if they have DonatorLevel at 1.

If I have it like this

[spoiler]if (cl.donatorLevel < 0) {
returnCode = 12;
}[/spoiler]

Then it will allow everyone in. Even if they don’t have Donator level[/quote]
I think i know your issue.
If you look at where you added it, you probably have it checking somewhere before it loads the players donor status.

Read full topic

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:19, topic:542719”]@lare96

That’s not really how you should be doing it. You don’t have to listen each world on a new port. Refer to how world selection works.[/quote]

lare69:

or an even better solution would be to have one networking server that accepts connections going to all worlds, then once the connection is accepted you can just dispatch the client to whichever world you want. that would probably be ideal since you would only have to have one port in use but you’d be running 3 servers (technically)

but how does world selection work, do you have any links explaining how its supposed to work?

Read full topic

A way i thought was neat is just teleporting the player to height level 4 lol. Then just add in the npcs and what not where you need them. Its silly but would work.

For a whole world I would not recommend doing that.

item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“Gh0stPred, post:17, topic:542719”][quote author=lare69 link=topic=661594.msg4422946#msg4422946 date=1399324742]
design your server where you can make multiple instances of the world, will make it 100x easier to do this
[/quote]

How can I do that?[/quote]

This is how I would go about doing the basis of it, could be wrong though but meh

[code=java]public class World {

// networking stuff
private EventSelector selector = new EventSelector();
private int port;

// entity stuff
private Player[] players = new Players[1000];
private Npc[] npcs = new Npc[2000];

// world stuff
private int worldId;

// … etc.

public World(int worldId, int port) {
this.worldId = worldId;
this.port = port;
}

public void start() {
// load utilities and whatever
selector.start(port); // start networking
Server.getWorlds().put(worldId, this); // register the world
}
}[/code]

then in the startup method something like

[code=java]private static Map<Integer, World> worlds = new HashMap<Integer, World>();

public static void main(String[] args) {
new World(1, 43594).start();
new World(2, 5555).start();
}[/code]

then with the map you would be able to check the data on certain worlds from other worlds and etc.

or an even better solution would be to have one networking server that accepts connections going to all worlds, then once the connection is accepted you can just dispatch the client to whichever world you want. that would probably be ideal since you would only have to have one port in use but you’d be running 3 servers (technically)

Read full topic
item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.description:
@Gh0stPred wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:14, topic:542719”][quote author=Gh0stPred link=topic=661594.msg4422933#msg4422933 date=1399320060]

The only thing that would need to change to make it either donor only or staff only is have the server check on log in to see if the person is in fact a donor or staff member.

More or less all you would need to add to your log in block is.

if (rank) {
continue on;
else
send message;
}

^
In RSLoginProtocolDecoder (in a standard pi) you could check the donator rights and if they’re not a donator have it return a return code (lol yeah) and then add that return code id client sided, which would show the appropriate message of “You must be a Donator to login” or similar.
If you’re wondering what I’m talking about, search “Error connecting to server” client sided, probably in Client.java.

Right. Thing is though I don’t have the file you were saying. I only have RS2LoginProcotol. I don’t have the Decoder one. I have added the Donator Code in there now I just need to get that code to work with the second world.

I have also added the message already regarding staff/donator.
[/quote]
Well… You can technically name the classes whatever… Because I don’t have RS2LoginProtocol but I have RS2LoginProtocolDecoder. So your file might be the same as mine, just a different name.[/quote]

Ahh ok. I’ll see if that works

EDIT:

Right. I managed to get it working BUT. Heres the new problem now. If I put the code like this

[spoiler]if (cl.donatorLevel == 0) {
returnCode = 12;
}[/spoiler]

No one can login even if they have DonatorLevel at 1.

If I have it like this

[spoiler]if (cl.donatorLevel < 0) {
returnCode = 12;
}[/spoiler]

Then it will allow everyone in. Even if they don’t have Donator level

item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @Gh0stPred Gh0stPred
item.description:
@Gh0stPred wrote:

[quote=“matzie, post:9, topic:542719”][quote author=Gh0stPred link=topic=661594.msg4422407#msg4422407 date=1399099669]
All I am after is a simple way to make 2 worlds. What i’ve done is that I have made 2 server classes (with different ports to define the world) so now I just need to make the second world only allow donators to connect.

Also how do I create a Login server?
[/quote]
Just learn basic network IO (java) With a serverSocket/socket connection. Then connect your servers to that host. So basically, your server’s will act as the clients do to your server.
Client -> Server -> Login Server
Client -> Server —^ ^
Client -> Server -------'
Where the server will request login information from your LS, checking if the current playerName is connected.
The login server needs to only exist of a way to “Join” and “leave” it. It should all be housed in your home network, no need to use any type of encryption because no private information should be sent.
(Only needs to send userName to LS, and recieve a loginState from it)[/quote]

Ok Thanks. I think I already have one because the Client has Multi world support. I just need to now know how to make it so that world connects for only Staff/Donators only

Image:

EDIT:

Btw I can run World 2 and be able to login to World 2 on the same Client.

Read full topic
item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Gh0stPred, post:8, topic:542719”]All I am after is a simple way to make 2 worlds. What i’ve done is that I have made 2 server classes (with different ports to define the world) so now I just need to make the second world only allow donators to connect.

Also how do I create a Login server?[/quote]
Just learn basic network IO (java) With a serverSocket/socket connection. Then connect your servers to that host. So basically, your server’s will act as the clients do to your server.
Client -> Server -> Login Server
Client -> Server —^ ^
Client -> Server -------'
Where the server will request login information from your LS, checking if the current playerName is connected.
The login server needs to only exist of a way to “Join” and “leave” it. It should all be housed in your home network, no need to use any type of encryption because no private information should be sent.
(Only needs to send userName to LS, and recieve a loginState from it)

Read full topic

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Well… It all depends on how everything is set up. Are the char files connected in all worlds? etc.
In world 3, the staff world, where it handles the player logging in (again, idk how your worlds are set up) make it check the playerRights of the person, and deny if it’s too low/high etc…

In w1/w2 like ashi said, just throw a boolean in that is set to true when they login, and if it’s true deny other logins.

Read full topic
item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @Gh0stPred Gh0stPred
item.description:
@Gh0stPred wrote:

[quote=“Ashi, post:2, topic:542719”]You could try something very simple and have like a boolean saying playerOnline for when the player is online, if that variable is true send “you are already logged in message”.

Then you can make both sources load the char file from one directory. I’m not sure if this would work but you could make a char folder on your desktop then have a shortcut in the sources if you can’t be bothered to change the paths in the code

That should in theory work. It’s not how I would do it though.[/quote]

Yeah. I don’t really want to have 2 sources and all that. I made a server2 class and even though that helped me with the multi world it will allow people to login to 2 worlds at the same time

Read full topic
item.source: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc

item.title: Syncing Worlds and making Worlds for Staff Only etc
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

You could try something very simple and have like a boolean saying playerOnline for when the player is online, if that variable is true send “you are already logged in message”.

Then you can make both sources load the char file from one directory. I’m not sure if this would work but you could make a char folder on your desktop then have a shortcut in the sources if you can’t be bothered to change the paths in the code

That should in theory work. It’s not how I would do it though.

Read full topic
